item.title: Dummy
item.dc:creator: @jaruanna jaruanna
item.description:
@jaruanna wrote:


is this saying that if the item does not equal -1, it shouldn't execute? shouldnt it be [code]if ((item == ID) || (item == ID))... {[/code]
From what i know, i think that's the problem.

is this saying that if the item does not equal -1, it shouldn’t execute? shouldnt it be if ((item == ID) || (item == ID))... {
From what i know, i think that’s the problem.

item.title: Dummy
item.dc:creator: @Pzezima2 Pzezima2
item.description:
@Pzezima2 wrote:

Hello This is my code for attacking dummies. This works when I spawn the item 23921 (Dummy) and attack it but the dummys in varrock arnt that ID so I changed it to 823 and it still doesnt work.

[code] public final int DUMMY_OBJECT = 823;
public final int DUMMY_DELAY = 1500;

public boolean hitDummy(final Client player, int object, int x, int y) {

	if (object != DUMMY_OBJECT) {
		return false;
	}

	int item = player.playerEquipment[3];
	if(item != -1){
	String weaponName = Server.getItemManager().getItemDefinition(item).getName();
	if(weaponName.contains("bow") || weaponName.contains("knife") || weaponName.contains("staff") || weaponName.contains("dart") || weaponName.contains("javelin") || weaponName.contains("karils") || weaponName.contains("c'bow") || weaponName.contains("seercull") || weaponName.contains("crossbow") || weaponName.contains("thrownaxe")){
		player.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("You must equip a bow in order to shoot-at targets.");
		return false;
	}
	} else {
		player.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("You must equip a bow in order to shoot-at targets.");
		return false;
	}

	if(Misc.random(60)==1){
		player.getAA2().checkrandom();
		return false;
	}
	if (player.checkBusy()) {
		return true;
	}

	player.setBusy(true);
	player.getActionAssistant().startAnimation(player.getCombat().getAnimation());
	player.getActionAssistant().turnTo(x, y);

	EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(player, new Event() {

		@Override
		public void execute(EventContainer c) {
			int xpp = player.playerLevel[0]/6;
			if(xpp < 1){
				xpp = 1;
			}
			player.getActionAssistant().addSkillXP(486000000*xpp, SkillConstants.ATTACK);
			player.getActionAssistant().sendMessage("You hit the dummy.");
			c.stop();
		}

		@Override
		public void stop() {
			player.getActionAssistant().startAnimation(-1);
			player.setBusy(false);
		}

	}, DUMMY_DELAY);

	return true;
}[/code]
